title: Champion Insights: Tahm Kench, the River King

{{champion:268}} "I Eat Bird Seeds"
Where did you guys come up with the name Tahm Kench, and why did you guys include two names?

Spoke to WAAARGHbobo about this. The goal of the two part name is to infuse him with a certain folksiness. There's a lot of internal contradiction in him: he's wearing nice clothes, but they're kinda tattered. He's dressed like a city man with his vest and his tophat, but he speaks like a country bumpkin. The name reinforces the country aspect, and at the same time it has some really cool etymological implications (like the antiquated English verb "to kench", to laugh out loud, and the old Welsh last name Kench which derives from a bin used for salting and preserving fish).

Ah, I get it. You wanted to give him the classy southern charm. Someone like Atticus from * To Kill a Mockingbird* character but in a more monstrous appearance. He has poetic wording but has a hint of southwestern in his voice. Almost Cajun, if I may say it. Dang, this support fits me better than I thought, since we live in close related areas. And I'm a support main. Also, I see the hint of catfish (look it up) in his look. We love catfish.

I must say it. THANKS! I love this smooth talking, Cajun support. He's my kind of support.

**Edit**

Sorry about the misspell. I was so excited, I just tried to get it out there before I had to go somewhere. I should had spell checked, but I'm glad to see it wasn't too big of a mistake as I almost spelled him Adackas, but changed my mind. I also kept having the quote from Scout in my head saying her father would always say something about "how to kill a mocking bird" but it may just be the 1960s movie line. I'll fix it and please, I'm sorry for making people mad.

Atticus ***
To Kill a Mockingbird ***

Sorry. I cringed hard.
Dreamworks' _How to Kill Your Mockingbird_.
My last name is Kench, plx be op so as to not bring dishonor to my family...

Tahm Kench, the River King = **River Tahm** = Also a very, very subtle etymological reference to **River Tam**? 

Or am I just imagining things in desperation for a Firefly reference? lol
i didnt know my southern accent made me a country bumpkin -__-
I don't think that was meant in a rude way, and being a Texan myself we do have agrarian roots.
Is Tahm pronounced like Tom?

Yeah "Tom Kench"  

Kinda cool southern name sounds like some shady southern business tycoon haha.
I searched up his name in google translate, from chinese, his name roughly translates to, "before he is willing to eat"
and why is it a mouthful why couldn't it be easier to say even if it was river king
lol it is two syllable, time to go back to grade school

I can't help but notice that Tahm Kench is the River King... so he's River Tahm? ...Also my brother is a huge fan of the radio personality Tom Kent so that's what I always think of when I hear the champ's name.

Probably coincidences, though. {{summoner:3}}

I think they were going for that southern tycoon kinda sounding name "Tahm Kench"  Which is pronounces like "Tom Kench"sounds kinda like one of those shady southern business folk. "Did you hear Tahm Kench is back in town"   "Tahm Kench you sly racoons underbelly"
Literally, Lickitung + Whiscash.
